title: Machine Learning in Acoustics: A Review and Open-Source Repository
author: Ryan A. McCarthy (Scripps Institution of Oceanography, UC San Diego), You Zhang (University of Rochester), Samuel A. Verburg (Technical University of Denmark), William F. Jenkins (Scripps Institution of Oceanography), Peter Gerstoft (Scripps Institution of Oceanography, Technical University of Denmark), ...
relevance_why: The paper details various machine learning techniques applicable to acoustics that can inform and enhance my research in audio processing and generation tasks, particularly regarding generative models and state-of-the-art methodologies.
background: The paper reviews advancements in using machine learning for analyzing and interpreting acoustic data across various fields, summarizing methodologies and providing an open-source repository of tools.
contribution: This paper introduces an open-source repository, AcousticsML, providing practical examples of applying machine learning solutions to various acoustic challenges, facilitating easier adoption of these technologies in research.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous works often lack comprehensive applications tailored specifically for the acoustics domain, resulting in insufficient practical guidance for researchers.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work consolidates diverse machine learning applications and offers reproducible examples through easy-to-use Jupyter notebooks, directly addressing acoustics-specific challenges.

key_innovation: The integration of state-of-the-art generative models and physics-informed neural networks for acoustic data, combined with a structured repository for practical implementation.
real_world_impact: The repository encourages users to adopt data-driven approaches to solve acoustic problems, potentially advancing both academic research and industry practices in acoustics.
limitations: The paper does not extensively address limitations of the models or the complexities involved in applying these techniques across different acoustic domains.

new_terms.AcousticsML: **AcousticsML** is an open-source repository featuring machine learning examples tailored specifically for acoustic data analysis and modeling.
new_terms.physics-informed neural networks: **Physics-informed neural networks (PINNs)** integrate physical laws into the training of neural networks to improve predictions related to physical phenomena.

open_sourcing: The repository is available on GitHub, featuring Jupyter notebooks for practical implementation of machine learning methods in acoustics.
